task_summary: The robot arm locates and navigates to the scissors, avoiding the obstacle (box/books) positioned between start and goal.

task_long_description.overview: This sequence takes place on a tabletop in an office setting. A robot arm must move from its initial position, perceive the target scissors located behind a central obstacle (a box or stack of books), and approach them without colliding. The behavior emphasizes visual reacquisition and obstacle avoidance, ending when the arm reaches the scissors' location.
preconditions: Robot arm is powered and homed.
Scissors and obstacle are present on table.
Camera or perception system is operational.
No objects obstructing arm's full range of motion.
success_criteria: Robot reaches scissors without colliding with obstacle.
Final arm pose is at or above scissors.
failure_and_recovery: Scissors not visible: perform rescan with retries.
Obstacle detected: trajectory replanned to avoid.
Partial move or collision: halt, retry or alert.
task_long_description.termination: Sequence terminates upon successful arrival at scissors or on repeated vision/movement failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: avoid obstacle and reach the scissors

node_specs.description: Checks if scissors are visually detected.
Scans for scissors using raster pattern, with up to 3 attempts.
Performs object detection to refine scissors location.
Moves arm to the detected scissors location, avoiding obstacles.

recovery_strategy: Rescan for scissors up to 3 attempts.
If obstacle blocks, trajectory should replan (implicit to arm's motion system).
Abort and notify after repeated failure.
assumptions: Instruction implied obstacle avoidance; frames confirm obstacle presence (box/books), but actual explicit MoveToXY/MoveDelta about obstacle not shownâ€”robot's motion planner presumed to avoid the obstacle.
No explicit force control required for simple reach; grasp not evidenced in frames.
Frames do not show grasp or manipulation, only approach, despite task wording.
Scissors assumed to be consistent symbolic target present in all frames.
Frame transitions align with perception & approach phases; no explicit manipulation or place phases.

expected_success_criteria: Robot arm reaches scissors without contacting box or other objects.
Scissors reliably detected before and during approach.
